TopicTitle: KerbalEdu Extends Kerbal Space Program Into Education

Articles.Content: <p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/6f2834fa3232c17f8cd6b56888912daf/tumblr_inline_mzuam9oRis1rr2wit.png"/><strong>Squad</strong> and <strong>TeacherGaming</strong> are proud to present <em><strong>KerbalEdu</strong></em>, an educational modification of <em><strong>Kerbal Space Program</strong></em>. <strong>TeacherGaming</strong>, like its prior popular release, <strong>MinecraftEdu</strong>, will mod <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> to enhance its value to professors and teachers in a classroom setting.<br/><br/>Several features are planned, including:<br/><br/>- Metric system and other systems for easier data comparison and integration with other school topics <br/><br/>- UI alterations to include analyzer and data collector tools for easier data gathering, data summarization and problem solving with ship designs<br/><br/>- Pre-made lessons that introduce or need a specific scientific method or formula to be solved, such as a rocket with too small of an engine needing more thrust <br/><br/>- Valuable materials outside of the actual game, but with heavy connections to it, that help educators drive home important lessons <br/><br/>For more on <em><strong>KerbalEdu</strong></em> and how you and your educators can utilize it in the classroom, click the link below.<br/><br/>LINK: <a href="http://bit.ly/IeFiav"><strong><a href="http://bit.ly/IeFiav">http://bit.ly/IeFiav</a></strong></a></p>
